subject: Physical Fitness
title: Arteries, Veins, and Capillaries
description: A quick, practical guide to Arteries, Veins, and Capillaries.

hook.text: Laid end to end, your blood vessels would circle the Earth twice. That's 100,000 km of plumbing.

buildup.text: Arteries carry blood away from the heart under high pressure. Their walls are thick and elastic.

discovery.text: Capillaries are one cell thick â€” thin enough for oxygen and nutrients to pass directly to tissues.

twist.text: Veins return blood under low pressure. They rely on one-way valves and muscle contractions to push upward.

climax.text: Exercise builds new capillaries in trained muscles, improving nutrient delivery at the cellular level.

punchline.text: Your vascular system is 100,000 km long. Training adds new roads.

quiz.question: How do veins return blood to the heart?
options: Direct pumping from the veins themselves
